subject: Real Estate
title: Central Park: The $5 Trillion Neighbor
description: One-minute skill: Central Park: The $5 Trillion Neighbor.

hook.text: Central Park occupies 843 acres of Manhattan. The real estate surrounding it is worth over $5 trillion.

buildup.text: When the park was designed in 1858, critics called it a waste of valuable land in a growing city.

discovery.text: The park's designers, Olmsted and Vaux, believed green space was essential for public health and social cohesion.

twist.text: The land was home to Seneca Village, a thriving Black community. Its residents were evicted to build the park.

climax.text: Central Park proved that public green space creates more economic value than any building ever could.

punchline.text: The best use of the most expensive land is grass and trees.

quiz.question: What happened to Seneca Village when Central Park was built?
options: It was incorporated into the park
